original: Berg, Sven Olof, lantbruksingenjör, Visby, f. 16/10/04 i Giresta kommun, Upps. 1., av goésäg. O. A. B. o. Elin Hermelin. G. 35 m. Greta Faulsson. Barn: Jan-Olof f. 37, Anders 39, Lennart 43. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 23, agro-nomex. v. Ultuna 27, civ:ing:ex. v. KTH 32. Stud:res. t. Holl. o. Tyskl. 36 (stip. fr. KTH), t. Tyskl. o. Tjec-koslov. 37 (resebidr. fr. lantbr :styr.). Statens lantbr :stip. 32, statens e. lantbr :mg. 35, ord. iantbr :ing. i Go’tl. 1 sed. 43. Led. av Sv. ’tekn:fören. 32, led. av styr. f. fören. Statens lantbr :-ing. 46, led. av styr. f. fören. Goti. vapen 46.
translated: Berg, Sven Olof, agricultural engineer, Visby, born October 16th, 1904 in Giresta municipality, Uppsala county, the eldest son of estate owners O.A.B. and Elin Hermelin. Married in 1935 to Greta Faulsson. Children: Jan-Olof (born 1937), Anders (born 1939), Lennart (born 1943). Education: graduated from Uppsala University in 1923, studied agricultural science at Ultuna in 1927, and earned a degree in civil engineering from KTH in 1932. Received scholarships to study in the Netherlands and Germany in 1936, and in Germany and Czechoslovakia in 1937 (funded by the Agricultural Board). Received a scholarship from the State Agricultural Board in 1932 and was employed by the state as an agricultural engineer in Gothenburg from 1943. A member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1932 and a board member of the State Agricultural Engineering Association since 1946. Also a board member of the Gotland Arms Association in 1946.
